results.title: The Jigsaw Man
results.creator_credit: Terence Young, Benjamin Fisz and J&M Entertainment
results.brief_description: Spy thriller inspired by the true story of British intelligence officer and Soviet spy Kim Philby (1912-1988). Having defected to Russia in 1979, Sir Philip Kimberly (Michael Caine), Cambridge graduate and former Director-General of M.I.6 is called upon by the Russians to carry out one last mission. With a different identity and a face altered beyond recognition by plastic surgery, he is sent back to England in the guise of a Soviet citizen to retrieve a secret dossier of names he supposedly hid there several years ago. When he decides to defect a second time the viewer is drawn into a complex web of espionage, counter-espionage and counter-counter-espionage where nothing is as it at first appears. Cast includes Laurence Olivier, Susan George and Robert Powell.

results.title: Too late the hero [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Robert Aldrich’s “Too late the hero” is a fine wartime drama set in WW II starring Cliff Robertson as Lt. Lawson, a US Navy interpreter who is ordered - against his own wishes - to join a British Commando unit in the South Pacific tasked with destroying a Japanese communications centre. Led by the incompetent Captain Hornsby (Denholm Elliott), the unit includes burnt-out soldiers - personified by the embittered, cynical Tosh Hearne (Michael Caine) - who want no part of the false glory inherent in this suicide mission for which they have been ‘volunteered’. The mission goes badly, with almost all of the men dying and the Japanese commander, Major Yamaguchi (Ken Takakura), taunting the survivors to give themselves up, working a psychological battle of wills against the allies as they turn on each other. Made in 1970 at a time when America was embroiled in Vietnam, “Too late the hero” is an intelligent, provocative and dramatic exploration of the nature of war and the role of the hero. Its portrayal of bloody and random killing and the manner in which men are reduced to their primal survival instincts during war is a milestone in the development of the war film. In addition, its avoidance of a standard caricatured portrayal of the Japanese is noteworthy. Filmed on location in the Philippines, “Too late the hero” is visually stunning, and boasts one of Michael Caine’s finest performances. Cast also includes Henry Fonda.

results.title: Without a clue
results.creator_credit: Thom Eberhardt, Mark Stirdivant and ITC Group
results.brief_description: What if the most famous detective of all time - Sherlock Holmes (Michael Caine) - was a drunk, gambling, womanizing, one time actor, created in the mind of his previously overshadowed but vastly superior assistant, Doctor Watson (Ben Kingsley)? Such is the premise of “Without a clue”. Fed up with Holmes’ bad form, Watson attempts to branch out on his own as the ‘Crime Doctor’, only to be told that it’s Holmes the people want. Thus, Holmes and Watson are forced to join sides again on a case involving counterfeit 5 pound notes. All is progressing well until the appearance of Holmes/Watson’s nemesis, Professor Moriaty, then Watson disappears into the canal - presumed dead, and it’s up to the oft inebriated Holmes to solve his first case, unassisted, and prove his crime solving capacity to the dubious Inspector Lestrade. Cast also includes Lysette Anthony, Jeffrey Jones and Paul Freeman.

results.title: Shirley Valentine
results.brief_description: Pauline Collins is Shirley Valentine-Bradshaw, a housewife and mother in cold dull England who dreams of adventure and stimulation. Her best friend wins a holiday in Greece and Shirley decides to come along. On the beautiful island of Mykonos, Shirley finds herself increasingly attracted to fisherman Costas (Tom Conti), and before the whirl wind two weeks on the Aegean is finished, she has to make big decisions about whether to return to her middle-class life back in England or to pursue the adventures of a new life promised by Greece and Costa. With the magical locales of Mykonos as a backdrop, “Shirley Valentine” is a perennial crowd pleasing comedy which also manages to develop some perceptive insights into the emotions and experiences of women in the middle years of their lives.

results.title: Hook
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Gerald Molen, Kathleen Kennedy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg filters J.M. Barrie’s ‘Peter Pan’ through a distinctly 90’s sensibility in ‘Hook’, a film of lost opportunities. Peter Pan has become Peter Banning (Robin Williams), a 40 year old lawyer with a permanent scowl on his face. Banning has lost all memory of being Peter Pan, and he is also in danger of losing his wife and children. When Peter and his family travel to London to visit Granny Wendy, Peter’s children are kidnapped by Captain Hook. As Peter recalls who he is and re-discovers his happy thoughts, he transforms into the Peter Pan of the past and goes to rescue his children. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.

results.title: The Sting [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Julia Phillips, Michael S Phillips, Tony Bill and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Johnny Hooker (Robert Redford) is a small time con-man working the backstreets of 1930s Chicago. When his partner is killed by mob boss Doyle Lonnegan, he teams up with down-and-out career criminal Henry Gondorff (Paul Newman), to dupe Lonnegan out of more than half a million dollars. The definitive ‘caper’ movie, “The Sting” features legendary ragtime piano by Scott Joplin and a superb supporting cast including Charles Durning, Eileen Brennan and Robert Shaw.

results.title: The Usual suspects [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bryan Singer, Michael McDonnell, Bad Hat Harry and Blue Parrot
results.brief_description: Usually when there is a crime, there is a motive. Usually when there is a line up, there is only one real suspect. However, this is not the usual crime and when five criminals are in the same lineup, there is a force operating behind the scenes pulling the strings to get them all together. “The Usual suspects” has an intriguing and twisted plot with exceptional performances from the entire cast which includes Gabriel Byrne, Stephen Baldwin, Kevin Pollak, Pete Postlethwaite, Chazz Palminteri and Kevin Spacey.

results.title: Vertical limit [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, Lloyd Phillips, Robert King and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Peter Garrett (Chris O’Donnell) and his sister Annie (Robin Tunney) lost their father to a tragic rock climbing accident, an accident that left Peter having to cut his father free from a rope they were all clinging to in order to save his and Annie’s lives. Years later, Annie has become a world class mountain climber who is hired by Elliot Vaughn to help him climb K2, the second highest peak in the world. Peter has given up climbing to become a nature photographer. In the middle of the climb bad weather strikes and Elliot, Annie and their crew find themselves trapped by an avalanche. Peter, working on an assignment near K2 organizes a rescue mission to help Annie and the other climbers before they run out of air.

results.title: The Crazy stranger = Gadjo dilo [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tony Gatlif, Guy Marignane and Princes Films
results.brief_description: Stephane is a young Parisian travelling through a remote area of Romania in search of a legendary singer whom he hopes to record. He encounters Izidor, a wizened gypsy who is bemoaning the imprisonment of his son, who takes Stephane under his wing. With a guide and patron to steer him through the chaotic and suspicion-driven world of the gypsies, Stephane soon becomes engrossed in a rambunctious lifelstyle which celebrates life through singing, drinking and cursing. In French and Romanian with English subtitles. Cast includes: Romaine Duris, Rona Hartner, Izidor Serban and Florin Moldovan. (Awards: include Paris Film Festival 1998; Locarno International Film Festival 1997 and Brussels International Film Festival 1998)

results.title: Grass [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Hemp advocate Woody Harrelson narrates this fascinating documentary about the history of marijuana legislation in the United States - from its arrival at the turn of the century when it was bought across the border from Mexico, up until the era of the Clinton Administration. Particular attention is paid to the formation of the Federal Bureau of Narcotics and the influence and legacy of its first Federal Commissioner- Anslinger. The program is divided into the war on drugs over the years, 1937-47, 1948-63, 1964-69, 1970-77, 1980-98 and defines the “official truth” about dope for the era (which covers a wide array of truths - linking it to degeneracy, heroin addiction, communism), and which strata of society was most associated with its usage at the time. What emerges is a political campaign that has increased from a $220 million dollar investment to a $214.7 billion one that continues on regardless. Archival ‘evidence’ of its damaging effects is provided from “dope” flicks such as “High on the range ” and “Reefer madness”, police training films, newsreel footage, Movietone News and media campaigns.
